poem:
Title: "The Courthouse Colour Spectrum"

When law turns a shade darker,
when words become a drawn dagger,
A flag flies upside down.
An echo of colorless town.
Trump's tower tilts in the fray,
Innocence lost to business-play.
Down the hall, a jury whispers,
Where verdicts bloom, and justice withers.
In this black and white masquerade,
Racism is the spade that's played.

Meanwhile, jury deliberations are ongoing in Trump’s business fraud trial in New York City, and a verdict could be delivered at anytime. Earlier".
